title: crypticj
author: crypticj
content: Hello everyone!Recently I see a lot of questions being asked on this forum like "Is it the best time to buy Bitcoin??", "should I buy Bitcoin right now?" etc. So I thought that it would be a great time to give a simple answer to these questions.I already have topics when I talk about when to buy bitcoin, but here I want to simplify it for everyone who still wondering about the timing.So, first of all, bitcoin is a GREAT technology and we all agree that it WILL go up and will cost much more in the future. That's why any time is actually a good time to buy Bitcoin. But if you want to lower the risks of investing in the wrong time, consider DCA. I still believe that DCA is the best method to invest money in Bitcoin.So the simple answer: if you don't want to risks and you belive in Bitcoin tech, then go and start DCAing right now.But for those who want to time Bitcoin, then right now is probably NOT the best time to buy BTC. Many people who say that Bitcoin has got up to 29k so it will keep going down just because, are probably wrong, cos they just ignore all macroeconomy statistics.I said it the last time and I will say it again: The economy is STILL in a bad place. We should not forget that high-interest rates are destroying an economy to lower inflation. So we are not done and it's not over yet.So when to buy Bitcoin then?Personally, I still think that we should follow what FED is going right now because they decide what to do with interest rates. I think the best time to start buying Bitcoin will be the moment FED will start lowering interest rates. After that (now immediately) economy will start getting better and, obviously, bitcoin will go up too.And I also think that when that will happen, bitcoin will be much lower than right now. Because statistically speaking, FED won't start lowering interest rates until something will go completely wrong and something big will collapse. Only that will be a good signal for them that it's time to stop.So, to recap everything I said here: if you just don't care about timing and want to buy Bitcoin, then start buying it right now (but only by DCA), and if you care about timing and want to take a risk to get bigger gains, then wait for the FED to start lowering rates and for the economy to become better.

Not to mention occasional futures trades and hedging. lol

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Before anyone realizes that the OP is serious in what he writes, you should read some of the previous threads he opened and see that his assumptions are mostly wrong. From the fact that the price of BTC will remain below $22 000 for a long time, to the fact that it will "very likely" fall towards $15 000.Quote from: crypticj on April 05, 2023, 06:51:46 AM~snip~So, to recap everything I said here: if you just don't care about timing and want to buy Bitcoin, then start buying it right now (but only by DCA), and if you care about timing and want to take a risk to get bigger gains, then wait for the FED to start lowering rates and for the economy to become better.Those who invest in Bitcoin should not make their decisions based on what central banks are doing, especially not waiting for interest rates to decrease and for the economy to experience some sort of recovery. Even if this happens and money becomes cheaper, it means that the demand for BTC will increase and that will push the price up - and then what logic is there in waiting to invest? Your advice is actually bad and you have been misleading people for months.

Simple formula to invest in most markets that I think anyone can apply successfully, do your research first and build capital, the process won't take much of your time, don't be too hasty to look at it someone's success without looking at what they've been through. DCA is a great formula, but the way I see people emotionally driven by the news makes the original theory slowly lose its value.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: So, have you been getting bigger gains because of this strategy? You've been here for around 6 years already. Which is better so far in terms of profit, to DCA or to buy Bitcoin in bulk following the Fed's decision? Personally, I don't care so much about what the central bank of a faraway country is doing. Especially when it comes to Bitcoin, I'd rather just acquire when I have the money to spare and hodl. After all, I don't think that Bitcoin's price is really in correlation with whatever decision the Fed makes about its decaying currency, notwithstanding those moments when there is seemingly one.
